720573f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Charles Street
720573f-a.text:
Hudson Street, west side, at Charles Street, showing at
the S. W. corner, Meyer's Pharmacy. Note the early over-
head sign board advertising Soverign Cigarettes.
Circa 1900
J. J. Corell, photo
P. L. Sperr Collection
720573f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Charles Street, Manhattan, NY

722555f-a.folder: Perry Street & Greenwich Street, Manhattan, NY

720572f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Charles Street
720572f-a.text:
Filling station on Hudson Street at the N.E. corner of Charles
Street, on the site of 538-542 Hudson Street, which were demolished
around 1930.
March 15, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
720572f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Charles Street, Manhattan, NY

733363f-a.title: Thanksgiving ragamuffins, No.40-42.
733363f-a.text:
(1)
Thanksgiving Ragamuffins, 1933, No. 40; The Texas Rangers al-
ways get their man. 541 Budson Street, on the west side, be-
tween Charles and Perry Streets.
November 30, 1933.
L. Sperr.
(2)
No. 41. At the grocery store on the N.W. corner of Hudson
and Perry Streets.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
No. 2. The same.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

720574f-a.text:

Street, and west on the south side of Charles Street.
March 29, 1933.

720575f-a.text:

March 29, 1933.

720257f-a.title: Manhattan: Greenwich Street - Perry Street
720257f-a.text:
729 Greenwich Street, adjoining the S. E. corner of
Perry Street. The archway shown leads to a center
garden and from which the interior apartments are
reached; there being several rear houses.
March 31, 1940
George D. Chinn
